Marco's last reflection emphasized resilience and adaptability. This requires two things:1) The tone must match his evolving character—still aristocratic in ambition but more pragmatic than before2) Popolani characters would respond better to formal yet accessible language, not Venetian patoisThe key is balancing Renaissance Venetian merchant authenticity with the game's technical constraints (food supply being a recurring issue). The phrase "your labor" deliberately elevates Chiara while acknowledging her value. The food mention anchors the conversation to Marco’s immediate needs while respecting Chiara’s social position.</think>"Buongiorno, amica mia. My apologies, I believe there may have been a misunderstanding earlier. While we are technically from different classes within Venetian society, your work in preparing our glass is essential for both our families and the Republic's commerce. Let us discuss how to best manage our mutual needs regarding food supplies while continuing with production."
